sql_generation_rules: ALWAYS use REAL dates from the database (e.g., '1996-07-15' for Northwind), NEVER use placeholders like 'YYYY-MM-DD'
If unsure about specific date values, use a date range or WHERE clause that works with actual data
Double-check that all date literals are valid PostgreSQL date formats
Do not use 'YYYY-MM-DD', 'DD/MM/YYYY', or any other date format placeholders
Use actual dates that exist in the database tables
Always verify table and column names exist in the schema
Use proper SQL syntax for PostgreSQL
Avoid subqueries in SELECT list unless necessary
Use JOINs instead of subqueries when possible for better performance
